title: 25 Best Architecture and Design Firms in Ukraine
description: In the face of adversity, cities like Kyiv, Lviv, and Kharkiv are home to firms that redefine what it means to build in times of uncertainty. The post 25 Best Architecture and Design Firms in Ukraine appeared first on Journal.
author: Architizer Editors
excerpt: In the face of adversity, cities like Kyiv, Lviv and Kharkiv are home to firms that redefine what it means to build in times of uncertainty.
text: Ukraine’s architectural landscape has evolved over centuries, shaped by diverse cultural influences and political shifts. This evolution began with the golden domes of Kievan Rus’ churches and the ornate Baroque cathedrals of the Cossack Hetmanate, culminating in the stark grandeur of Soviet modernism. During the 20th century, a range of urban transformations, primarily attributed to Soviet rule, introduced concepts of social housing blocks and public buildings in the form of monuments. Since gaining independence in 1991, contemporary firms have started blending traditional motifs with global design trends, embracing sustainability, adaptive reuse, and digital design technologies. Examples such as the revitalization of industrial spaces in Kyiv, the reappropriation of historic buildings in Lviv, and the residential developments in Kharkiv were all projects that reconstructed the built environment without deleting its distinct past. In recent years, the country’s architectural community has faced new challenges regarding preservation, resilience and rebuilding. In the face of adversity, cities like Kyiv, Lviv, and Kharkiv are home to firms that redefine what it means to build in times of uncertainty, producing designs that have purpose and a future positive vision. With so many architecture firms to choose from, it’s challenging for clients to identify the industry leaders that will be an ideal fit for their project needs. Fortunately, Architizer is able to provide guidance on the top design firms in Ukraine based on more than a decade of data and industry knowledge. How are these architecture firms ranked? The following ranking has been created according to key statistics that demonstrate each firm’s level of architectural excellence. The following metrics have been accumulated to establish each architecture firm’s ranking, in order of priority: The number of A+Awards won (2013 to 2025) The number of A+Awards finalists (2013 to 2025) The number of projects selected as “Project of the Day” (2009 to 2025) The number of projects selected as “Featured Project” (2009 to 2025) The number of projects uploaded to Architizer (2009 to 2025) Each of these metrics is explained in more detail at the foot of this article. This ranking list will be updated annually, taking into account new achievements of Ukraine architecture firms throughout the year. Without further ado, here are the 25 best architecture firms in Ukraine: 25. NOVA © NOVA NOVA – New Office of Vital Architecture is a young Ukrainian-based practice that works with architecture, landscape and interiors. Some of NOVA’s most prominent projects include: Mariupol City Hall, Mariupol, Ukraine The following statistics helped NOVA achieve 25th place in the 25 Best Architecture Firms in Ukraine: Featured Projects 1 Total Projects 1 24. Pominchuk Architects © Avdeenko Ivan Architecture studio “Pominchuk Architects” was founded in 2012. In our creative activity we refer to the experience of modern architecture and design and make a point of searching for new ways of solving design challenges. Some of Pominchuk Architects’ most prominent projects include: Arthouse, Ukraine The following statistics helped Pominchuk Architects achieve 24th place in the 25 Best Architecture Firms in Ukraine: Featured Projects 1 Total Projects 1 23. Sanina Arch Club © Sanina Arch Club We are creating holistic, harmonious experiences for people seeking a slower-paced lifestyle. Hospitality design and architecture. Some of Sanina Arch Club’s most prominent projects include: Krasnyk House, Ukraine The following statistics helped Sanina Arch Club achieve 23rd place in the 25 Best Architecture Firms in Ukraine: Featured Projects 1 Total Projects 1 22. Special Project Venediktov © Andre.Avdeenko Ukrainian architect Oleksii Venediktov works as an independent designer since 1996. Several years later he creates his own architectural bureau – SPECIAL PROJECT VENEDIKTOV. Oleksii Venediktov prefers architectural, interior and creative design and also the special, personal script to solve each project task. His architectural team is engaged in a full package of support: from design to implementation of the object. SPECIAL PROJECT VENEDIKTOV is motivated to work in the paradigm of modern and intelligent design. Some of Special Project Venediktov’s most prominent projects include: Green Apartment, Kiev, Ukraine The following statistics helped Special Project Venediktov achieve 22nd place in the 25 Best Architecture Firms in Ukraine: Featured Projects 1 Total Projects 1 21. SERA_design © SERA_design We design boldly, creatively, and inclusively at the edge, and push sustainability in ways that ripple. Learn more about what sustainability means at SERA. Some of SERA_design’s most prominent projects include: KOSS store, Barcelona, Spain Shota, Kyiv, Ukraine The following statistics helped SERA_design achieve 21st place in the 25 Best Architecture Firms in Ukraine: Featured Projects 1 Total Projects 2 20. YORK architects © YORK architects YORK architects, founded in 2018 by Roman and Daria Kurylenko in Kyiv. The company creates private architecture, commercial objects, interiors of large commercial objects, and private interiors. The studio includes 28 architects and designers. Some of YORK architects’ most prominent projects include: LEGEND, Kyiv, Ukraine 31 Apartment Complex, Kyiv, Ukraine The following statistics helped YORK architects achieve 20th place in the 25 Best Architecture Firms in Ukraine: Featured Projects 1 Total Projects 2 19. Scapes Concept Studio © Scapes Concept Studio Scapes Concept Studio is an architecture studio located in Odesa, Ukraine. According to its philosophy, spacescapes evolve from interior to urban scale. Some of Scapes Concept Studio’s most prominent projects include: FRAME project, Odesa, Ukraine CUBE, Odesa, Ukraine CORE project, Odesa, Ukraine The following statistics helped Scapes Concept Studio achieve 19th place in the 25 Best Architecture Firms in Ukraine: Featured Projects 1 Total Projects 3 18. Ponomarenko Bureau © Ponomarenko Bureau Ukraine based experimental Ponomarenko Bureau. Researching and playing with materials and spaces. Was founded in Kharkiv, Ukraine at 2020. Our bureau is in the top 30 of the National Rating of Creativity in Ukraine. Volodymyr Ponomarenko taught at the Children’s School of Architecture for three years and now he has his own course on object design at the Kharkov School of Architecture about recycling and upcycling. By rethinking everyday materials, inventing new ones, and redefining traditional methods, Ponomarenko Bureau creates design through experimentation. Some of Ponomarenko Bureau’s most prominent projects include: 23A, Kharkiv, Ukraine SIDERIYA, Kharkiv, Ukraine BLACK & MILK, Kharkiv, Ukraine CHERNYI, Kharkiv, Ukraine The following statistics helped Ponomarenko Bureau achieve 18th place in the 25 Best Architecture Firms in Ukraine: Featured Projects 1 Total Projects 4 17. Project 7 © Project 7 Each of our projects changes the world. Zoo. Theatre. Factory. All of these create new elements in the urban structure affecting those who are involved and those who are just passing by. We believe that format reinforces the content as well as surrounding affects the outcome. Thus, we create the space which is filled with inspiration. The space where everyone knows where he belongs. We work with leaders who build their future and move the world forward. We work with people who feel the need to improve the whole environment for themselves and others.Each of our projects is the result of inclusive cooperation between customer and architect, between developer and society. Some of Project 7’s most prominent projects include: “Roshen” winter bar, Kyiv, Ukraine “Roshen” fair module, Kyiv, Ukraine CHERKASY ZOO. Exposition «Hoofed animals», Cherkasy, Ukraine Underground passes, Kyiv, Ukraine The following statistics helped Project 7 achieve 17th place in the 25 Best Architecture Firms in Ukraine: Featured Projects 1 Total Projects 4 16. MCORP Architects © MCORP Architects Design and construction company MCORP provides a full range of services in real estate. Beginning with the selection of the site, ending with the presentation of the “keys” to the house, apartment, office. Detailed study of the project at all stages of production works, modern approach, teamwork, transparency of relations is the hallmark of our company. Some of MCORP Architects’ most prominent projects include: LHT_SPA, Kharkiv, Ukraine DSN HOUSE, Kyiv, Ukraine STRICT_HOUSE, Kharkiv, Ukraine ELEMENTS_HOUSE, Kharkiv, Ukraine FRND HOUSE, Kharkiv, Ukraine The following statistics helped MCORP Architects achieve 16th place in the 25 Best Architecture Firms in Ukraine: Featured Projects 1 Total Projects 8 15. loft buro © loft buro We are a creative team of professional architects, designers, engineers, and artists since 2004. The studio pays particular attention to its activities in interior design by planning about a hundred restaurants, apartments, houses, offices and hotels. We look at historical facts, study legends, history, and culture, and then adapt these influences with new materials and the latest design trends. Our concept is to be focused more on an interior philosophy through research of symbols and color solutions. Some of loft buro’s most prominent projects include: East-West, Kyiv, Ukraine Rodychi, Zhashkiv, Ukraine Ostannya Barykada Lviv, Lviv, Ukraine Inside the Wall, Kyiv, Ukraine Ugli, Kyiv, Ukraine The following statistics helped loft buro achieve 15th place in the 25 Best Architecture Firms in Ukraine: Featured Projects 1 Total Projects 10 14. Aranchii Architects © Aranchii Architects Studio works in fields of computational architecture, parametric and algorithmic design. Some of Aranchii Architects’ most prominent projects include: PROSTIR bussines hub, Zymna Voda, Ukraine M17 Contemporary Art Centre Rethinking, Kyiv, Ukraine KLO Flagship Gas Station Facade, Kyiv, Ukraine Sustainable Continuity, Kyiv, Ukraine Signature Garden, Kiev, Ukraine The following statistics helped Aranchii Architects achieve 14th place in the 25 Best Architecture Firms in Ukraine: Featured Projects 1 Total Projects 13 13. Nat Telichenko © Nat Telichenko Nat Telichenko is an architect based in Ukraine, whose work is mostly centered around residential architecture. Some of Nat Telichenko’s most prominent projects include: Baan Bubble, Kharkiv, Ukraine Baan Bubble PLAN B, barbershop & museum The following statistics helped Nat Telichenko achieve 13th place in the 25 Best Architecture Firms in Ukraine: Featured Projects 1 Total Projects 3 12. AKZ Architectura © AKZ Architectura From high goals to budget decisions, from small spaces to large-scale projects, our practice is always based on three main principles: Create a beautiful space for everyday purposes.Be free from “ready-made” solutions. Attention to details and functionality. Collaborative creative processes. We believe in what we do. Some of AKZ Architectura’s most prominent projects include: Orang+Utan, Kiev, Ukraine Naive champagne bar, Kiev, Ukraine The following statistics helped AKZ Architectura achieve 12th place in the 25 Best Architecture Firms in Ukraine: Featured Projects 2 Total Projects 2 11. POLOTNO ARCHITECTS © POLOTNO ARCHITECTS Polotno Architects is an architecture bureau, undertaking a broad range of projects. Our projects range in scale from a small residential house to a multi functional office building or a town concept. Each project evolves from a site analysis, including the existing natural elements and built environment, to the concept that responds to the client and it`s neighborhood. Our goal is to implement a balance between architecture, people and nature, as well as the balance between the social mission of architecture and its economic benefit. We design environment to provide an attractive space that will not only carry the pragmatic function of architecture but also create interest. Some of POLOTNO ARCHITECTS’ most prominent projects include: GOLOSIEV HILLS 2.0, Kyiv, Ukraine Obolon Resedential Complex, Kyiv, Ukraine DMYTRYVSKYI CLUB HOUSE, Kyiv, Ukraine TRINITY APARTMENT COMPLEX RBD HOUSE, Kyiv, Ukraine The following statistics helped POLOTNO ARCHITECTS achieve 11th place in the 25 Best Architecture Firms in Ukraine: Featured Projects 2 Total Projects 7 10. Vizdome Space © Vizdome Space We provide architectural design and interior design services for homes, offices, public spaces. We work online throughout Ukraine. Some of Vizdome Space’s most prominent projects include: The Wasp Nest. Futuristic universal unit Chumatskyi Shlyah. Memorial of Ukrainian heroes, Khmelnytskyi, Ukraine Desert Rose – Futuristic Cleaning Chamber Interior of the hotel room «Concrete Jungle» | Vizdome Space The Magic Mushroom Story, Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates The following statistics helped Vizdome Space achieve 10th place in the 25 Best Architecture Firms in Ukraine: Featured Projects 2 Total Projects 15 9. MONO architects © MONO architects MONO architects are experts in creating stylish, functional public spaces and residential interiors. Regardless of the project purpose, we strive to create a well rounded product: each design element has a specific purpose, there is nothing superfluous. We blend a minimalism approach with modern developments and innovations in order to achieve the perfect balance of comfort and aesthetics. Our ideas and solutions often go beyond the generally accepted norms, as we do not focus on acceptability, but we’d rather wish to achieve the maximum flawlessness in everything we work on. Vast experience (more than 70 successfully implemented projects) allows us quickly find a common ground with the client, clearly define the task and create a truly unique space relevant for many years to come. Some of MONO architects’ most prominent projects include: NUDE apartment, Kyiv, Ukraine M1 House, Ukraine Infinity Villa, Kyiv, Ukraine Lobby in Tetris Hall, Kyiv, Ukraine Franco House, San Francisco, California The following statistics helped MONO architects achieve 9th place in the 25 Best Architecture Firms in Ukraine: A+Awards Finalist 1 Featured Projects 1 Total Projects 10 8. Between the Walls © Between the Walls We are the team of interior architecture designers who create an emotional spatial experience. Each of our projects is an individual story inscribed between the walls. We have our own approach to design – we believe that space should continue and reveal its inhabitants, convey its interests, style and even character. Therefore, we do not just arrange the furniture correctly and choose the right color, we create the concept, functionality and mood. What lies between the walls really matters to us. Some of Between the Walls’ most prominent projects include: Marballoon, Kyiv, Ukraine Painter’s lake house, Latvia Single Malt, Kyiv, Ukraine Gont Cottage, Ukraine Microhome , Dilove, Ukraine The following statistics helped Between the Walls achieve 8th place in the 25 Best Architecture Firms in Ukraine: A+Awards Finalist 1 Featured Projects 2 Total Projects 19 7. TETIANA DENYSENKO INTERIOR DESIGN © Savchenko Sergey TETIANA DENYSENKO INTERIOR DESIGN is a design firm located in Ukraine. It specializes in the design of private residential facilities. Some of TETIANA DENYSENKO INTERIOR DESIGN’s most prominent projects include: CREAM, Kyiv, Ukraine URBAN, Kyiv, Ukraine HARMONY, Kyiv, Ukraine Office of the law firm, Kyiv, Ukraine COCONUT, Kyiv, Ukraine The following statistics helped TETIANA DENYSENKO INTERIOR DESIGN achieve 7th place in the 25 Best Architecture Firms in Ukraine: Featured Projects 3 Total Projects 10 6. Golub Architects © Golub Architects The architectural company Golub Architects was founded in 2012 by certified Ukrainian architects, scientists, laureates and winners of a number of international architectural competitions by Andriy and Kristina Golub, who have joined their efforts into a single creative group that strives to design and build a progressive architecture using innovative approaches and the latest technologies. Starting from 2012 we have designed more than 60 projects that are geographically located in Ukraine, the USA, Australia, Austri and Greece. At present, Golub Architects carries out a full range of design services, from concept to detail design documentation, and also collaborates as a subcontractor with US and UK architectural companies. Our clients are natural persons, private companies, government and public organizations. We are open to cooperation and we are always looking for reliable partners and investors to implement common projects. Some of Golub Architects’ most prominent projects include: Grey House, Berlin, Germany Houses for internally displaced persons in Ukraine, Ukraine Strut House, Kyiv, Ukraine Black Edition House Interior, Kyiv, Ukraine The Snake, Ryde, Australia The following statistics helped Golub Architects achieve 6th place in the 25 Best Architecture Firms in Ukraine: Featured Projects 3 Total Projects 16 5. YODEZEEN © YODEZEEN YODEZEEN — a multi-award-winning architecture and design studio delivering bespoke projects. Artur Sharf and Artem Zverev established the studio in 2010 in their desire to create a knowledge-based approach to design and architecture. With offices in Miami, Los Angeles, Dubai, Warsaw, Kyiv, Milan and London, YODEZEEN is distinguished by its high-end design, international expertise, and local capability. The studio works across various typologies, including residential, commercial, and hospitality projects, spanning the USA, UK, Europe, the Middle East, South America — including Mexico and Brazil — and India. Some of YODEZEEN’s most prominent projects include: Rising Retreat, Ukraine Desert Loft, Kiev, Ukraine Sombra House, Castelldefels, Spain Casa Nori, Kiev, Ukraine Virid Edition, Kyiv, Ukraine The following statistics helped YODEZEEN achieve 5th place in the 25 Best Architecture Firms in Ukraine: Featured Projects 3 Total Projects 33 4. SHOVK © SHOVK SHOVK is a team of specialists in creating modern, exciting and functional projects in the field of interior design and architecture. Having gained European experience in designing residential, commercial, and public facilities, since 2015 we have been realizing the dreams of our clients, who share our understanding of aesthetics and philosophy. The studio’s portfolio includes numerous implemented projects around the world. Some of SHOVK’s most prominent projects include: Rzhyshchiv cabins Terekh.group office, Kyiv, Ukraine Kerala house, Kyiv, Ukraine Como refugee social center Craco wellness resort The following statistics helped SHOVK achieve 4th place in the 25 Best Architecture Firms in Ukraine: A+Awards Winner 1 Featured Projects 3 Total Projects 19 3. SBM studio © SBM studio ‘SBM Studio’ is a bureau of architecture and design, which was founded in Kharkiv, Ukraine in 2002. Despite having extensive experience in creating projects for commercial and residential buildings, we have been gradually shifting our focus from individual orders to improving city space and the processes which occur within it. We value interaction between people and nature and believe that a lot can be learnt by honoring the traditions and culture of a society. At the same time, we implement technological innovations in order to create unique projects. Our work has received multiple awards and has been published in numerous reference editions and periodicals worldwide. Some of SBM studio’s most prominent projects include: Architecture office, Kharkiv, Ukraine Sarzhyn Yar, Kharkiv, Ukraine Svoyeridne showroom, Kharkiv, Ukraine Weekends House, Kharkiv Oblast, Ukraine House in Kharkiv, Kharkiv, Ukraine The following statistics helped SBM studio achieve 3rd place in the 25 Best Architecture Firms in Ukraine: A+Awards Winner 1 Featured Projects 2 Total Projects 5 2. YOD design lab © YOD design lab YOD is a studio of commercial design based in Kyiv, Ukraine. Studio’s story began in 2004 when its founder Volodymyr Nepyivoda and art director Dmytro Bonesko had united their efforts and brought together talented architects and designers. Since then we are engaged predominantly in the sphere of commercial design creating projects for hospitality sector: hotels, restaurants, bars and cafes. Taking on any new project, we want to become a reliable partner who is familiar with restaurant business and shares client’s vision. First of all, we search the idea which will be borne in people’s mind and bring long-standing customers. To create a perfect image of the object, we design individually furniture, lighting and decoration, implement experimental solutions, create naming, graphic design and dishes serving. Today we have the best restaurants in our portfolio and successful restaurateurs and hoteliers among our clients. Some of YOD design lab’s most prominent projects include: Chalet 4.0 in Relax Park Verholy, Poltava, Ukraine EAST restaurant, Kiev, Ukraine Chalet 3.0, Poltava, Ukraine Guest Houses 2.0, Poltava, Ukraine Guest houses in Relax Park Verholy, Poltava, Ukraine The following statistics helped YOD design lab achieve 2nd place in the 25 Best Architecture Firms in Ukraine: Featured Projects 5 Total Projects 35 1. archimatika © archimatika We turn investments into profits via architecture. A team of architects, engineers, designers, and innovators. Archimatika specializes in design and planning of large residential and mixed-use development sites as well as planning of whole city districts. The company provides the full range of general designer services, such as architecture, MEP, structural design, project management and author supervision support of the project till the end of construction. The company’s projects are aimed at increasing the value of real estate by the ultimate satisfaction of businesses and citizens. In every project, the company strives to emphasize the individual features of the site and find aesthetic, practical and economical solutions to make every project best in its class. Archimatika is a renowned leader in applying BIM technologies. Some of archimatika’s most prominent projects include: Lucky Land, Kyiv, Ukraine Business center | Kanalna street, Kyiv, Ukraine Public Center RC Republic, Kyiv, Ukraine Milltown, Lviv, Ukraine Slavutych, Kyiv, Ukraine Featured image (top): Comfort Town, Kyiv, Ukraine The following statistics helped archimatika achieve 1st place in the 25 Best Architecture Firms in Ukraine: Featured Projects 6 Total Projects 52 Why Should I Trust Architizer’s Ranking? With more than 30,000 architecture firms and over 130,000 projects within its database, Architizer is proud to host the world’s largest online community of architects and building product manufacturers. Its celebrated A+Awards program is also the largest celebration of architecture and building products, with more than 400 jurors and hundreds of thousands of public votes helping to recognize the world’s best architecture each year. Architizer also powers firm directories for a number of AIA (American Institute of Architects) Chapters nationwide, including the official directory of architecture firms for AIA New York. An example of a project page on Architizer with Project Award Badges highlighted A Guide to Project Awards The blue “+” badge denotes that a project has won a prestigious A+Award as described above. Hovering over the badge reveals details of the award, including award category, year, and whether the project won the jury or popular choice award. The orange Project of the Day and yellow Featured Project badges are awarded by Architizer’s Editorial team, and are selected based on a number of factors. The following factors increase a project’s likelihood of being featured or awarded Project of the Day status: Project completed within the last 3 years A well written, concise project description of at least 3 paragraphs Architectural design with a high level of both functional and aesthetic value High quality, in focus photographs At least 8 photographs of both the interior and exterior of the building Inclusion of architectural drawings and renderings Inclusion of construction photographs There are 7 Projects of the Day each week and a further 31 Featured Projects. Each Project of the Day is published on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram Stories, while each Featured Project is published on Facebook. Each Project of the Day also features in Architizer’s Weekly Projects Newsletter and shared with 170,000 subscribers. We’re constantly look for the world’s best architects to join our community. If you would like to understand more about this ranking list and learn how your firm can achieve a presence on it, please don’t hesitate to reach out to us at editorial@architizer.com.
html:
Ukraine’s architectural landscape has evolved over centuries, shaped by diverse cultural influences and political shifts. This evolution began with the golden domes of Kievan Rus’ churches and the ornate Baroque cathedrals of the Cossack Hetmanate, culminating in the stark grandeur of Soviet modernism. During the 20th century, a range of urban transformations, primarily attributed to Soviet rule, introduced concepts of social housing blocks and public buildings in the form of monuments.

Since gaining independence in 1991, contemporary firms have started blending traditional motifs with global design trends, embracing sustainability, adaptive reuse, and digital design technologies. Examples such as the revitalization of industrial spaces in Kyiv, the reappropriation of historic buildings in Lviv, and the residential developments in Kharkiv were all projects that reconstructed the built environment without deleting its distinct past. In recent years, the country’s architectural community has faced new challenges regarding preservation, resilience and rebuilding. In the face of adversity, cities like Kyiv, Lviv, and Kharkiv are home to firms that redefine what it means to build in times of uncertainty, producing designs that have purpose and a future positive vision.

With so many architecture firms to choose from, it’s challenging for clients to identify the industry leaders that will be an ideal fit for their project needs. Fortunately, Architizer is able to provide guidance on the top design firms in Ukraine based on more than a decade of data and industry knowledge.

How are these architecture firms ranked?

The following ranking has been created according to key statistics that demonstrate each firm’s level of architectural excellence. The following metrics have been accumulated to establish each architecture firm’s ranking, in order of priority:

  • The number of A+Awards won (2013 to 2025)
  • The number of A+Awards finalists (2013 to 2025)
  • The number of projects selected as “Project of the Day” (2009 to 2025)
  • The number of projects selected as “Featured Project” (2009 to 2025)
  • The number of projects uploaded to Architizer (2009 to 2025)

Each of these metrics is explained in more detail at the foot of this article. This ranking list will be updated annually, taking into account new achievements of Ukraine architecture firms throughout the year.

Without further ado, here are the 25 best architecture firms in Ukraine:

25. NOVA

© NOVA

NOVA – New Office of Vital Architecture is a young Ukrainian-based practice that works with architecture, landscape and interiors.

Some of NOVA’s most prominent projects include:

  • Mariupol City Hall, Mariupol, Ukraine

Why Should I Trust Architizer’s Ranking?

With more than 30,000 architecture firms and over 130,000 projects within its database, Architizer is proud to host the world’s largest online community of architects and building product manufacturers. Its celebrated A+Awards program is also the largest celebration of architecture and building products, with more than 400 jurors and hundreds of thousands of public votes helping to recognize the world’s best architecture each year.

Architizer also powers firm directories for a number of AIA (American Institute of Architects) Chapters nationwide, including the official directory of architecture firms for AIA New York.

An example of a project page on Architizer with Project Award Badges highlighted

A Guide to Project Awards

The blue “+” badge denotes that a project has won a prestigious A+Award as described above. Hovering over the badge reveals details of the award, including award category, year, and whether the project won the jury or popular choice award.

The orange Project of the Day and yellow Featured Project badges are awarded by Architizer’s Editorial team, and are selected based on a number of factors. The following factors increase a project’s likelihood of being featured or awarded Project of the Day status:

  • Project completed within the last 3 years
  • A well written, concise project description of at least 3 paragraphs
  • Architectural design with a high level of both functional and aesthetic value
  • High quality, in focus photographs
  • At least 8 photographs of both the interior and exterior of the building
  • Inclusion of architectural drawings and renderings
  • Inclusion of construction photographs

There are 7 Projects of the Day each week and a further 31 Featured Projects. Each Project of the Day is published on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram Stories, while each Featured Project is published on Facebook. Each Project of the Day also features in Architizer’s Weekly Projects Newsletter and shared with 170,000 subscribers.

We’re constantly look for the world’s best architects to join our community. If you would like to understand more about this ranking list and learn how your firm can achieve a presence on it, please don’t hesitate to reach out to us at editorial@architizer.com.
